data.title: Office of the Historian
data.text:
U.S. Recognition of the Armenian Republic, .

The United States recognized the independence of the Armenian Republic on , when Secretary of State Bainbridge Colby delivered a note to the Representative of the Armenian Republic (Pasdermadjian) in Washington, informing him of President Woodrow Wilson’s decision. The note specified that this recognition “in no way predetermines the territorial frontiers, which…are matters for later delimitation.”
